body: Those are all set to seconds/minutes/hours as the max units. Feel free to submit a PR if you'd like to help improve the documentation!

Note that we have two sorts of durations we have `time.Duration` which only support `h, m, s, ms` and `fs.Duration` which supports them all.

We should either document which are which, or change all of them to be `fs.Duration` or maybe a combination.

It seems that `--dir-cache-time 1d` would be useful to support.

Here are the flags which are `time.Duration` (these appear with lowercase `duration` whereas `fs.Duration` appears with uppercase `Duration` so we can tell them apart conveniently.

```
$ rclone help flags . | grep duration
      --contimeout duration                  Connect timeout (default 1m0s)
      --expect-continue-timeout duration     Timeout when using expect / 100-continue in HTTP (default 1s)
      --fs-cache-expire-duration duration    Cache remotes for this long (0 to disable caching) (default 5m0s)
      --fs-cache-expire-interval duration    Interval to check for expired remotes (default 1m0s)
      --kv-lock-time duration                Maximum time to keep key-value database locked by process (default 1s)
      --max-duration duration                Maximum duration rclone will transfer data for
      --modify-window duration               Max time diff to be considered the same (default 1ns)
      --rc-job-expire-duration duration      Expire finished async jobs older than this value (default 1m0s)
      --rc-job-expire-interval duration      Interval to check for expired async jobs (default 10s)
      --rc-server-read-timeout duration      Timeout for server reading data (default 1h0m0s)
      --rc-server-write-timeout duration     Timeout for server writing data (default 1h0m0s)
      --retries-sleep duration               Interval between retrying operations if they fail, e.g. 500ms, 60s, 5m (0 to disable)
      --stats duration                       Interval between printing stats, e.g. 500ms, 60s, 5m (0 to disable) (default 1m0s)
      --timeout duration                     IO idle timeout (default 5m0s)
      --b2-download-auth-duration Duration           Time before the authorization token will expire in s or suffix ms|s|m|h|d (default 1w)

$ rclone mount --help | grep duration
    --dir-cache-time duration   Time to cache directory entries for (default 5m0s)
    --poll-interval duration    Time to wait between polling for changes. Must be smaller than dir-cache-time. Only on supported remotes. Set to 0 to disable (default 1m0s)
    --vfs-cache-max-age duration         Max age of objects in the cache (default 1h0m0s)
    --vfs-cache-poll-interval duration   Interval to poll the cache for stale objects (default 1m0s)
    --vfs-write-back duration            Time to writeback files after last use when using cache (default 5s)
    --vfs-read-wait duration   Time to wait for in-sequence read before seeking (default 20ms)
    --vfs-write-wait duration  Time to wait for in-sequence write before giving error (default 1s)
      --attr-timeout duration                  Time for which file/directory attributes are cached (default 1s)
      --daemon-timeout duration                Time limit for rclone to respond to kernel (not supported on Windows)
      --daemon-wait duration                   Time to wait for ready mount from daemon (maximum time on Linux, constant sleep time on OSX/BSD) (not supported on Windows) (default 1m0s)
      --dir-cache-time duration                Time to cache directory entries for (default 5m0s)
      --poll-interval duration                 Time to wait between polling for changes, must be smaller than dir-cache-time and only on supported remotes (set 0 to disable) (default 1m0s)
      --vfs-cache-max-age duration             Max age of objects in the cache (default 1h0m0s)
      --vfs-cache-poll-interval duration       Interval to poll the cache for stale objects (default 1m0s)
      --vfs-read-wait duration                 Time to wait for in-sequence read before seeking (default 20ms)
      --vfs-write-back duration                Time to writeback files after last use when using cache (default 5s)
      --vfs-write-wait duration                Time to wait for in-sequence write before giving error (default 1s)

```

Maybe @olefrost and @albertony might have some thoughts about this?

It might be possible to make a flags shim to convert `time.Duration` to `fs.Duration` and back to avoid us having to ripple through all the changes.

I'm going to re-open this for further discussion.

rename.from: Duration suffixes don't work above h
rename.to: Duration suffixes are inconsistent, some support y, M, w, d suffix and some don't

body:
It's just a doc fix really as if a person has to type 24h or 1d, I can't fathom why 1 character is going to be problematic. This has been asked a number of times over the course of the years. If you want to make them all the same, sure.

Or just someone needs to do a PR for a doc fix to make it clear.

I think making them all the same, somehow, is a very good idea. Simply documenting current behaviour would help, of course, but I think that alone would still leave quite a few users confused about this little gotcha..

I concur, if it's easy to make it universal, that's clearly the best option, but from a resource perspective, I don't see it being urgent  or critical. 

Doc fixes are quick though.

It turned out that it is easy to make all flags take the extra suffixes with a bit of out of the box thinking!

This doesn't include backend parameters, but these are all using `fs.Duration` not `time.Duration` already.

[v1.61.0-beta.6555.552d39339.fix-6556-duration-suffixes](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-6556-duration-suffixes/v1.61.0-beta.6555.552d39339.fix-6556-duration-suffixes/) on branch [fix-6556-duration-suffixes](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-6556-duration-suffixes) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

See: 552d39339307dc45f0eb78c85b371fa5e6a6f16a

@jasondavis303 can you give this a test please?

I did a few tests with days/weeks/years and seems to work fine in accepting the parameters and starting up:


```
felix@gemini:~/rclone-v1.61.0-beta.6555.552d39339.fix-6556-duration-suffixes-linux-amd64$ ./rclone mount GD: /home/felix/test --dir-cache-time 1y -vvv
2022/11/10 12:56:27 DEBUG : Setting --config "/opt/rclone/rclone.conf" from environment variable RCLONE_CONFIG="/opt/rclone/rclone.conf"
2022/11/10 12:56:27 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.61.0-beta.6555.552d39339.fix-6556-duration-suffixes" starting with parameters ["./rclone" "mount" "GD:" "/home/felix/test" "--dir-cache-time" "1y" "-vvv"]
2022/11/10 12:56:27 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "GD:"
2022/11/10 12:56:27 DEBUG : Using config file from "/opt/rclone/rclone.conf"
2022/11/10 12:56:27 DEBUG : Google drive root '': Mounting on "/home/felix/test"
2022/11/10 12:56:27 DEBUG : : Root:
2022/11/10 12:56:27 DEBUG : : >Root: node=/, err=<nil>
^C2022/11/10 12:56:30 INFO  : Signal received: interrupt
2022/11/10 12:56:30 ERROR : /home/felix/test: Unmounted rclone mount
2022/11/10 12:56:30 INFO  : Exiting...
2022/11/10 12:56:30 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.61.0-beta.6555.552d39339.fix-6556-duration-suffixes" finishing with parameters ["./rclone" "mount" "GD:" "/home/felix/test" "--dir-cache-time" "1y" "-vvv"]

felix@gemini:~/rclone-v1.61.0-beta.6555.552d39339.fix-6556-duration-suffixes-linux-amd64$ ./rclone mount GD: /home/felix/test --dir-cache-time 1w -vvv
2022/11/10 12:56:08 DEBUG : Setting --config "/opt/rclone/rclone.conf" from environment variable RCLONE_CONFIG="/opt/rclone/rclone.conf"
2022/11/10 12:56:08 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.61.0-beta.6555.552d39339.fix-6556-duration-suffixes" starting with parameters ["./rclone" "mount" "GD:" "/home/felix/test" "--dir-cache-time" "1w" "-vvv"]
2022/11/10 12:56:08 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "GD:"
2022/11/10 12:56:08 DEBUG : Using config file from "/opt/rclone/rclone.conf"
2022/11/10 12:56:08 DEBUG : GD: Loaded invalid token from config file - ignoring
2022/11/10 12:56:09 DEBUG : Saving config "token" in section "GD" of the config file
2022/11/10 12:56:09 DEBUG : Keeping previous permissions for config file: -rwxrwxr-x
2022/11/10 12:56:09 DEBUG : GD: Saved new token in config file
2022/11/10 12:56:09 DEBUG : Google drive root '': Mounting on "/home/felix/test"
2022/11/10 12:56:09 DEBUG : : Root:
2022/11/10 12:56:09 DEBUG : : >Root: node=/, err=<nil>
^C2022/11/10 12:56:20 INFO  : Signal received: interrupt
2022/11/10 12:56:20 ERROR : /home/felix/test: Unmounted rclone mount
2022/11/10 12:56:20 INFO  : Exiting...
```

> It turned out that it is easy to make all flags take the extra suffixes with a bit of out of the box thinking!
> 
> This doesn't include backend parameters, but these are all using `fs.Duration` not `time.Duration` already.
> 
> [v1.61.0-beta.6555.552d39339.fix-6556-duration-suffixes](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-6556-duration-suffixes/v1.61.0-beta.6555.552d39339.fix-6556-duration-suffixes/) on branch [fix-6556-duration-suffixes](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-6556-duration-suffixes) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)
> 
> See: [552d393](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/commit/552d39339307dc45f0eb78c85b371fa5e6a6f16a)
> 
> @jasondavis303 can you give this a test please?

It's working in the beta! Thank you guys

Thanks for testing :-)

I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) in 15-30 minutes and released in v1.61
